Method Detail

loadBeanInfo

public static java.beans.BeanInfo loadBeanInfo(java.lang.ClassLoader loader,
                                               java.lang.String uri)
load a BeanInfo for URI If uri string start with character '/' the bean info will be loaded using XmlBeanInfo.loadFromUri factory method, otherwise the uri will be loaded using Class.forName

Parameters:
loader - classloader used for load the resource ( null for default )
uri - resource uri

createBeanDescriptor

public static java.beans.BeanDescriptor createBeanDescriptor(java.lang.Class<?> beanClass,
                                                             java.lang.String entityName)
create a default BeanDescriptor 
  Example:

  public BeanDescriptor getBeanDescriptor() {
    return BeanManagerUtils.createBeanDescriptor( beanClass, "<entity>" );
  }

Parameters:
beanClass - bean Class
entityName - name of db entity (table)
Returns:
new BeanDescriptor
See Also:
BeanDescriptor, BeanInfo.getBeanDescriptor()

getBeanProperties

@Deprecated
public static java.beans.PropertyDescriptor[] getBeanProperties(java.beans.BeanInfo beanInfo)
Deprecated. 

get all properties of bean info ( getAdditionalBeanInfo also ) - if there is a name conflict the beanInfo properties have the precedence

Parameters:
beanInfo - BeanInfo
Returns:
PropertyDescriptor[] all properties as array

getJavaType

public static java.lang.Class<?> getJavaType(int sqlType,
                                             boolean returnRawType,
                                             boolean ignoreSqlType)
Parameters:
sqlType - sql type belong to java.sql.Types
returnRawType - if true will be returned the raw java type (byte, char, int ...), otherwise not (Byte, Character, Integer, ...)
ignoreSqlType - if true the class belong to java.sql package will be ignored. (e.g. instead of Blob will be returned Byte[] or byte[] depends on previous flag)
Returns:
related java class

instantiateBean

public static java.lang.Object instantiateBean(java.beans.BeanInfo beanInfo)
                                        throws java.lang.InstantiationException
create a new bean as described within given beanInfo If there are dynamic property descriptors will be invoked the setter method for each property with null value

Parameters:
beanInfo -
Returns:
bean instance
Throws:
java.lang.InstantiationException

                                                             java.beans.PropertyDescriptor... b)
Create a new property array as result of joining the properties arrays given in input

Parameters:

b -
Returns:
new array ( a + b )

aggregateProperties

public static java.beans.PropertyDescriptor[] aggregateProperties(java.lang.Class<?> beanClass,
                                                                  java.beans.PropertyDescriptor[] properties,
                                                                  java.beans.BeanInfo... aggregate)
This method is useful to join properties between bean infos. The field properties belonging to aggregates are transformed in PropertyJoin automatically It is very useful for create aggregate Bean Info 
    final BeanInfo aggregate = new AggregateBeanInfo();





Parameters:
beanClass - class of the Owner Bean
properties - properties of the Owner BeanInfo
aggregate - BeanInfo array

Returns:

IN

public static java.lang.String IN(java.util.Collection<?> parameters)
Utility function that generate IN clause parameters - i.e. (?,?,?, .... ) Usage.: Collection params = Arrays.AsList( {"P1", "P2", "P3" } ); manager.find( conn, result, String.format( "${field} IN %s ", IN(params) ), params );

Parameters:
parameters - parameters collection
Returns:
IN parameters
